# Bricks Bucket: Postman Collection Schema

>**IMPORTANT NOTICE**
>
>This repository is part of the [Bricks Bucket project](https://github.com/javier-games/upm-bricks-bucket), which was canceled in 2022. This repository will remain publicly archived for reference and forking purposes.

## Overview

This Unity package provides C# model classes representing the Postman Collections schema, supporting Postman Collections version 2.0. These models facilitate the manipulation and use of Postman collection data within Unity projects, making it easier to parse, generate, and integrate these collections.

### Package Details

- **Package Name:**
    ```
    games.javier.upm.bricksbucket.web.postman
    ```
- **Display Package Name:**
    ```
    Javier Games
    ```
- **NPM Registry URL:**
    ```
    https://registry.npmjs.org
    ```
- **Scope(s):**
    ```
    games.javier
    ```

## Installation

The package can be installed through multiple channels as [npm](https://www.npmjs.com/package/games.javier.upm.bricksbucket.web.postman), [OpenUPM](https://openupm.com/packages/games.javier.upm.bricksbucket.web.postman) or a downloadable Tarball from the [Releases section](https://github.com/javier-games/upm-postman-collections/releases) of this repository or from the dedicated [itch.io page](https://javier-games.itch.io/bricks-bucket).
For detailed installation instructions, please refer to the guide on our [installation documentation page](https://installation.upm.javier.games).

This repository is archived and no longer actively maintained. Forks and community-driven improvements are welcome.
